sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Old English Fragments of the Legend of the Cross

p.supplied: This MS description is not part of the M. R. James catalogue; it is based in part on the description given in Vaughan and Fines, 'Handlist', p. 117.

msDesc.p: Two Old English fragments of a single leaf on the legendary history of the Cross before Christ, from Worcester. Removed in 1952 from printed books donated to the College by Matthew Parker, SP.4, Tercia pars Chronici Carionis (Basle 1543) etc., and SP.260, Fides Iesu et Iesuitarum (Strasbourg, 1573).

Mounted in melanex seemingly sealed. Bound in a folder. Details and references in N. R. Ker, Catalogue of Manuscripts containing Anglo-Saxon (1957), p. 122. Ker states that they are 'presumably part of a homily for the Invention of the Cross' like that in MS Bodley 343.

head.title: Old English fragments of the Legend of the Cross

recordHist.p: text: typed from Vaughan and Fines 'Handlist' CF
markupCheck: checked by CF, but not by a second person
